listitem.para: @javax.ws.rs.PathParam
Extract values from URI path
@javax.ws.rs.MatrixParam
Extract values from URI matrix portions
@javax.ws.rs.QueryParam
Extract values from URI query portion
@javax.ws.rs.FormParam
Extract values from FORM data
@javax.ws.rs.HeaderParam
Extract values from request headers
@javax.ws.rs.CookieParam
Extract values from cookies set by client
@javax.ws.rs.core.Context
Injects helper and informational objects

listitem.para: MatrixParam convenient but does not handle repeated params with same name (i.e., two elements of path with same attribute name)
Must use PathSegment to compensate

section.title: PathSegment and Matrix Parameters

listitem.para: Both the path element and associated matrix parameters injected as a set
Matrix parameters accessible thru collection interface

section.para: Server now accepts matrix property with path element
section.programlisting: log.info(doCall(new HttpGet(httpMethodsURI + "/injection4/22;units=feet")));
section.para: Client passes in units as matrix parameter for path element
section.programlisting: -PathInfo: /httpmethod/injection4/22;units=feet -GET http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection4/22;units=feet => 200 -/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection4/22;units=feet => m19() pp1=22;units=feet value=22, units=feet
section.para: Server provides path parameter and matrix parameter to method

section.title: Multiple Segments

listitem.para: Matching segments injected into method
Easy parsing of undefined path

section.para: Matches any path below /httpmethod/injection5 and breaks each element into a separate PathSegment
section.programlisting: log.info(doCall(new HttpGet(httpMethodsURI + "/injection5/22/11/red/convertable")));
section.para: Caller provides path with four segments
section.programlisting: -PathInfo: /httpmethod/injection5/22/11/red/convertable -GET http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection5/22/11/red/convertable => 200 -/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection5/22/11/red/convertable => m20() pp=[22, 11, red, convertable]
section.para: Server breaks the four segments into separate PathSegments
section.programlisting: log.info(doCall(new HttpGet(httpMethodsURI + "/injection5/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red")));
section.para: Client passes matrix parameters with segments

section.title: Programmatic Access to URI Information

listitem.para: Bypass mapping URI information to specific variables
Object provided to query properties on demand

section.para: Container injects UriInfo object to be queried for information
section.programlisting: log.info(doCall(new HttpGet(httpMethodsURI + "/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red?qt1=hello&qt2=world")));
section.para: Client makes query with several path elements
section.programlisting: -PathInfo: /httpmethod/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red -GET http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red?qt1=hello&qt2=world => 200 -http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red?qt1=hello&qt2=world => m21() absPath=http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/httpmethod/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red baseUri=http://dmv.ejava.info:9092/jaxrs-resources-dmv-war6/ path=/httpmethod/injection6/22;units=feet/11;units=inch/red matchedUris=[/httpmethod/injection6/22/11/red] matchedResources=[ejava.examples.jaxrscs.httpmethod.rs.HttpMethodDemoRS@83b00f] pathSegments=[httpmethod, injection6, 22;units=feet, 11;units=inch, red] queryParams={qt1=[hello], qt2=[world]}
section.para: Container provides requested information

listitem.para: getAbsolutePath() - provides full URL
getBaseURI() - provides root of Web Application
getPath() - provides relative path below base URI
getMatchedURIs() - provides list of URIs from the class to the method that matched
getMatchedResources() - provides list of resource objects that matched
getPathSegments() - provides list of path segments demonstrated in previous section
getQueryParameters() - provides query params that follow the "?" in the path
few more...
